Module flag4j
Package org.flag4j.arrays.dense

Class CMatrix

java.lang.Object
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.AbstractTensor<CMatrix,Field<Complex128>[],Complex128>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.TensorOverSemiRing<CMatrix,CMatrix,Field<Complex128>[],Complex128>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.TensorOverRing<CMatrix,CMatrix,Field<Complex128>[],Complex128>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.TensorOverField<CMatrix,CMatrix,Field<Complex128>[],Complex128>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.FieldTensorBase<CMatrix,CMatrix,Complex128>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.DenseFieldMatrixBase<CMatrix,CooCMatrix,CsrCMatrix,CVector,Complex128>
org.flag4j.arrays.dense.CMatrixOld
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, DenseMatrixMixinOld<CMatrix,CooCMatrix,CVector,Field<Complex128>[],Complex128>, DenseTensorMixin<CMatrix,CooCMatrix>, MatrixMixinOld<CMatrix,CMatrix,CVector,CVector,Field<Complex128>[],Complex128>, MatrixVectorOpsMixin<CMatrix,CVector,CVector>, TensorBinaryOpsMixin<CMatrix,CMatrix>, TensorMixin<CMatrix,Field<Complex128>[],Complex128>
public class CMatrix extends DenseFieldMatrixBase<CMatrix,CooCMatrix,CsrCMatrix,CVector,Complex128>

A complex dense matrix backed by a Complex128 array.

A CMatrix has mutable entries but fixed shape.

A matrix is essentially equivalent to a rank 2 tensor but has some extended functionality and may have improved performance for some operations.

See Also:

    • I

      public static CMatrix I(int numRows, int numCols)
      Constructs an identity matrix with the specified shape. If the specified shape is not square, then a rectangular matrix with ones along the principle diagonal will be created.
      Parameters:
      numRows - Number of rows in the identity matrix.
      numCols - Number of columns in the identity matrix.
      Returns:
      An identity matrix with the specified shape. If the specified shape is not square, then a rectangular matrix with ones along the principle diagonal will be created.
      See Also:
      • I(Shape)

    • I

      public static CMatrix I(Shape shape)
      Constructs an identity matrix with the specified shape. If the specified shape is not square, then a rectangular matrix with ones along the principle diagonal will be created.
      Parameters:
      numRows - Number of rows in the identity matrix.
      numCols - Number of columns in the identity matrix.
      Returns:
      An identity matrix with the specified shape. If the specified shape is not square, then a rectangular matrix with ones along the principle diagonal will be created.
      See Also:
      • I(int, int)

    • matrixRank

      public int matrixRank()

      Computes the rank of this matrix (i.e. the number of linearly independent rows/columns in this matrix).

      This is computed as the number of singular values greater than tol where: 

      double tol = 2.0*Math.max(rows, cols)*Flag4jConstants.EPS_F64*Math.min(this.numRows, this.numCols);

      Note the "matrix rank" is NOT related to the "tensor rank" which is number of indices needed to uniquely specify an entry in the tensor.

      Specified by:
      matrixRank in interface DenseMatrixMixinOld<CMatrix,CooCMatrix,CVector,Field<Complex128>[],Complex128>
      Overrides:
      matrixRank in class DenseFieldMatrixBase<CMatrix,CooCMatrix,CsrCMatrix,CVector,Complex128>
      Returns:
      The matrix rank of this matrix.

    • mult

      public CMatrix mult(Matrix b)
      Multiplies this complex dense matrix with a real dense matrix.
      Parameters:
      b - The second matrix in the matrix multiplication.
      Returns:
      The matrix product of this matrix and b.
      Throws:
      LinearAlgebraException - If this.numCols != b.numRows

    • isUnitary

      public boolean isUnitary()
      Checks if this matrix is unitary. That is, if this matrices inverse is equal to its Hermitian transpose.
      Returns:
      True if this matrix it is unitary. Otherwise, returns false.

    • round

      public CMatrix round()
      Rounds this tensor to the nearest whole number. If the tensor is complex, both the real and imaginary component will be rounded independently.
      Returns:
      A copy of this tensor with each entry rounded to the nearest whole number.

    • round

      public CMatrix round(int precision)
      Rounds a matrix to the nearest whole number. If the matrix is complex, both the real and imaginary component will be rounded independently.
      Parameters:
      precision - The number of decimal places to round to. This value must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      A copy of this matrix with rounded values.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If precision is negative.

    • roundToZero

      public CMatrix roundToZero()
      Rounds values which are close to zero in absolute value to zero. If the tensor is complex, both the real and imaginary components will be rounded independently. By default, the values must be within Flag4jConstants.EPS_F64 of zero. To specify a threshold value see roundToZero(double).
      Returns:
      A copy of this tensor with rounded values.

    • abs

      public Matrix abs()
      Computes the element-wise absolute value of this matrix.
      Overrides:
      abs in class DenseFieldMatrixBase<CMatrix,CooCMatrix,CsrCMatrix,CVector,Complex128>
      Returns:
      The element-wise absolute value of this matrix.

    • flatten

      public CMatrix flatten()
      Flattens matrix to a single row.
      Overrides:
      flatten in class FieldTensorBase<CMatrix,CMatrix,Complex128>
      Returns:
      The flattened matrix.
      See Also:
      • FieldTensorBase.flatten(int)

    • roundToZero

      public CMatrix roundToZero(double threshold)
      Rounds values which are close to zero in absolute value to zero.
      Parameters:
      threshold - Threshold for rounding values to zero. That is, if a value in this matrix is less than the threshold in absolute value then it will be rounded to zero. This value must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      A copy of this matrix with rounded values.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If threshold is negative.

    • isReal

      public boolean isReal()
      Checks if this complex matrix only contains real values.
      Returns:
      True if every entry in this matrix has zero imaginary component. False otherwise.

    • isComplex

      public boolean isComplex()
      Checks if this complex matrix contains at least one non-real value.
      Returns:
      True if at least one value in this matrix is non-real. False otherwise.

    • setValues

      public void setValues(double[][] values)
      Sets the values of this matrix to values.
      Parameters:
      values - New values of the array. Must have shape new double[this.numRows][this.numCols].
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If values.length != this.numRows || values[0].length != this.numCols.

    • setSlice

      public CMatrix setSlice(Matrix values, int rowStart, int colStart)
      Creates a copy of this matrix and sets a slice of the copy to the specified values. The rowStart and colStart parameters specify the upper left index location of the slice to set.
      Parameters:
      values - New values for the specified slice.
      rowStart - Starting row index for the slice (inclusive).
      colStart - Starting column index for the slice (inclusive).
      Returns:
      A reference to this matrix.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If rowStart or colStart are not within the matrix.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the values slice, with upper left corner at the specified location, does not fit completely within this matrix.

      cols - The number of columns in this matrix.

    • pow

      public CMatrix pow(int n)

      Computes the matrix multiplication of this matrix with itself n times. This matrix must be square.

      For large n values, this method may significantly more efficient than calling

      invalid reference 
      this.mult(this)
      a total of n times.

      Parameters:
      n - Number of times to multiply this matrix with itself. Must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      If n=0, then the identity
